str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From huperballo; a throwing beyond others, i.e. supereminence; adverbially pre- eminently.
An unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation. From apokalupto; disclosure.
Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: Lit: To raise beyond, uplift; mid: To lift myself up, exalt myself, be arrogant.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Perhaps from the base of skelos and optanomai; withered at the front, i.e. A point or prickle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To strike with the fist, buffet; hence: I mistreat violently. From a derivative of the base of kolazo; to rap with the fist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
